sen.j: 建保元年（1213年）、北条氏に対して和田氏の一族が挙兵した和田合戦のとき、実朝と父祖との板ばさみになり、出家し実阿弥陀仏、高円坊と名乗り、京都へ向かった。
sen.e: When in 1213, during the Battle of WADA in which the family of the Wada clan raised an army against the Hojo clan, Tomomori was torn between Sanetomo and Tomomori's grandfather; as result, Tomomori became a priest, called himself Amida Buddha, Koenbo, and headed to Kyoto.

sen.j: しかし、彼は父・常盛とともに弓の名手であったため、その武勇が必要だった祖父・義盛は、叔父・和田義直（義盛の四男）を遣わし、その中途の駿河国から連れ戻させてしまった。
sen.e: However, since he was a master of yumi (bow) like his father Tsunemori, Yoshimori, Tomomori's grandfather who needed his grandson's military prowess, sent Tomomori's uncle, Yoshinao WADA (Yoshimori's fourth son), to take Tomomori back from Suruga Province, which was halfway to Kyoto.
